headline: Chevron (CVX) Valuation Check as Venezuelan Exports Continue Under Tightening U.S. Sanctions
summary: Chevron (CVX) is back in focus as it keeps loading and exporting Venezuelan crude under a U.S. license, even as sanctions tighten and a naval blockade raises the geopolitical stakes. See our latest analysis for Chevron. Those Venezuelan cargoes are landing at a time when Chevron’s share price, now around $150.5, has seen a modest year to date share price return of 2.58 percent. Its five year total shareholder return of 118.13 percent shows that long term, patient investors have still been...
